articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The US is sending Ukraine cluster bombs, rockets and other weapons in a new $375 million military aid package.
articles.title: The US is sending Ukraine cluster bombs, rockets and other weapons in a new $375 million military aid package

articles.author: ABBY SEWELL and NATALIE MELZER
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Israel said it killed a top commander with Hezbollah’s missile and rocket unit Tuesday as the Israeli military traded fire with Hezbollah again and the death toll from a massive Israeli bombing campaign climbed to nearly 560 people.
articles.title: Israeli military says it killed a top Hezbollah commander as the two sides exchange more strikes

articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — After almost a year of trading fire, Israel and the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah are now engaged in ferocious confrontations that threaten to turn into a full-blown war.
articles.title: What is Hezbollah, the group battling Israel in Lebanon?

articles.author: JULIA FRANKEL and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: MUWASI, Gaza Strip (AP) — As the escalating conflict between Israel and Hezbollah grabs global attention, Palestinians in Gaza wonder: What will become of their plight after nearly a year of devastating war?
articles.title: As Israel's fight with Hezbollah heats up, people of Gaza fear being forgotten

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI, MATTHEW LEE and ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — President Joe Biden declared in his final address to the U.N.
articles.title: Biden in farewell U.N. address says peace still possible in conflicts in Mideast and Ukraine

articles.author: EDITH M. LEDERER and JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: UNITED NATIONS (AP) — The head of the United Nations warned the gathered leaders of nations Tuesday that impunity, inequality and uncertainty are driving modern civilization toward “a powder keg that risks engulfing the world" — the latest in an increasing number of clarion calls from Antonio Guterres in recent years that the global situation is becoming intolerable and unsustainable.
articles.title: Head of United Nations calls global situation 'unsustainable' as annual meeting of leaders opens

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — Donald Trump is expected on Tuesday to pledge not only to stop U.S. businesses from offshoring jobs, but also to take other countries’ jobs and factories.Among the ideas he is planning to pitch is luring foreign companies to the U.S.
articles.title: Trump wants to lure foreign companies by offering them access to federal land

articles.author: ALI SWENSON
articles.description: In Georgia, election workers will have to hand count the number of ballots cast after voting is completed.
articles.title: Several states are making late changes to election rules, even as voting is set to begin

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. will send Ukraine an undisclosed number of medium-range cluster bombs and an array of rockets, artillery and armored vehicles in a military aid package totaling about $375 million, U.S.
articles.title: US to send $375 million in military aid to Ukraine, including medium-range cluster bombs

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Two major weather systems are bringing heavy rain, high winds and more to Mexico's southern Pacific coast on one side and the Caribbean on the other.Tropical Storm John struck Mexico late Monday with life-threatening flood potential after growing into a Category 3 hurricane in a matter of hours.
articles.title: Tropical Weather Latest: Tropical Storm Helene forms in Caribbean, Tropical Storm John weakens
